title: Man stopped by Bromsgrove police for not having correct waste disposal paperwork is fined
content:
A MAN unable to produce notes detailing where he was disposing waste when he was stopped by Bromsgrove police has been fined. 
 
George Anderson, of Friar Park Road, Wednesbury, pleaded guilty at Redditch Magistrates Court on Thursday, September 10, after he failed to produce Waste Transfer Notes for his house and garden clearance business when he was stopped in Bromsgrove by police as part of routine checks. 
 
The court heard that the 21-year-old had previously received a fixed penalty notice when he initially failed to produce the relevant paperwork but had been prosecuted following his failure to pay. 
   
 Share article  
   
As well as contributing towards the £878 case costs he was ordered to pay a victim surcharge of £30. 
 
Bromsgrove District Council’s head of environmental services, Guy Revans, said: “We need to make sure that waste being disposed of in our district is done so properly and our enforcement team remains diligent to do just this."
